pullRequest.title: NMS-12521: Use protobuf instead of bson for Netflow
pullRequest.bodyText:
Move the serialization from bson to protobuf for all Netflow related protocols.
External References

JIRA (Issue Tracker): http://issues.opennms.org/browse/NMS-12521
Bamboo (Continuous Integration): https://bamboo.opennms.org/

nodes.bodyText:
I would like to try and maintain avoiding having knowledge of specific payloads in the Telemetry API.
I realize this may be required if we want to combine the protobuf definitions though and avoid intermediary byte arrays though. IMO it would only be worth doing this if we we're able to show some associated performance benefits.

nodes.bodyText:
Not sure if this will work out well. In sflow it's still possible to return multiple flows from one incoming message.
Collections.singletonList should make it easy to implement the original interface.
Should be Optional.ofNullable.
Should be Optional.ofNullable
SmaplingAlgorithm is an enum by itself. We should use the enum variants instead of the number.
Should be Optional.ofNullable
Use the variants here, too.
I'm not sure if "" is semantically equal to null in this case.
VLAN 0 is not equal to no VLAN
I would prefer to have these messages in the parser and keep the proto implementations clean of that knowledge.
I would prefer to have these messages in the parser and keep the proto implementations clean of that knowledge.
Any reason to remove these finals?
Is this really required in the api module or can the dependency be moved to the transport module?

     </plugins>
   </build>
   <dependencies>
+    <dependency>

nodes.bodyText: This can implement the Converter interface and can be used instead of the {Netflow 5, Netflow9, IPFIX} specific converter implementations. And Therefore it should be renamed, too.

nodes.bodyText: Organize your imports :)

Maybe we can add a generic NetflowAdapter which reduces the duplicated code in all adapters (which will be all the same, if we unify the Converters). The old Adapter implementations should kept for backward compatibility but will reduce to empty sub-classes.
Same as for IpfixAdapter.
Same as for IpfixAdapter.
Same as for IpfixConverter.
Same as for IpfixConverter.
This can will be obsolete if FlowMapper will implement Converter

Can we move the FlowMessageBuilder implementations to the parser module and let the parser do the dispatch by an abstract method (something like protected abstract FlowMessageProtoOrBuilder buildMessage(record, enrichment).
In addition, there are a couple of methods below, which still do BSON stuff. Are the still needed?
This dispatching should be done in the parsers...
Is this really required? The simple no-op RecordEnrichement implementation can be moved to the tests and the original method can be called instead.
I'm not sure about this one. I would prefer to use the Values visitor instead of instanceof.
Maybe this should return Optional instead of a hard coded default.
This would benefit from Optionals, too.
I can't see any usage - do I miss something?
Maybe this should be called makeTypeValue or buildTypeValue.

I think this can be simplified by assuming that there will be only one value for each of these "duplicates" which we try to resolve with the first(...) calls below.
As an example:
Intant flowEnd should be just. You can set it for all its variants (flowEndSeconds, flowEndMilliseconds, flowEndMicroseconds, ...) and just overwrite it if it really should occur more than once.
This would reduce the complexity to just the handling of the absolute and the delta values.
This is true for a couple of other fields, too.
Things like this would simplify if getTypeValue would return an Optional.
Don't use isPresent. This can be done by nested firsts and single ifPresent which will set the value.
Oh man, this thing is quite a mess - but I don't have any idea on how to make it any better.
Remove them if they are not used.

nodes.bodyText: Please do not commit stuff like this - makes review more hard...
The package should be netflow.transport, to. This was a little confusing...
This should be removed as it's not used.
This should be formatted as CAPITALS_WITH_UNDERSCORES.
Do not commit stuff like this, please.
I can't find any usage of this - is it still needed?

This should be moved to a standalone class.
The old *Flow (like IpfixFlow) classes can be removed.

nodes.bodyText: I can see this is useful during the transition but I would prefer to get rid of the BSON stuff completely. My proposal is to generate the BSON output one last time and use it to generate some JSON which will be used in this tests instead.
What's the difference?
Just make the method throws Exception.
Same here

afterCommit.message:
NMS-12521: Move from bson to proto for netflow

NMS-12521: Some more refactoring

NMS-12521: Fix integration tests and may be smoke as well

NMS-12521: Move FlowMessage, fix features

NMS-12521: Use protobuf wrapper for all primitives

NMS-12521: Fix sentinel telemetry

NMS-12521: Avoid empty values for addresses

NMS-12521: Add more validation tests

NMS-12521: Refactor to proto
